content.text: <image 1>The graph below shows the variation of the strong nuclear force with nucleon separation.Which of the points A, B, C or D shows the repulsive nature of the strong nuclear force?

The repulsive nature of the strong nuclear force is shown by point A on the graph. At very short distances (point A), the strong nuclear force is repulsive, which helps to prevent nucleons from collapsing into each other. As the distance increases, the force becomes attractive (points B and C) and then diminishes at larger distances (point D).

final_answer: The repulsive nature of the strong nuclear force is shown by point A on the graph. At very short distances (point A), the strong nuclear force is repulsive, which helps to prevent nucleons from collapsing into each other. As the distance increases, the force becomes attractive (points B and C) and then diminishes at larger distances (point D).
label: A
